title: 5/17/2017 - DirectX Issues with AMD/Radeon Graphics Cards
body:
[](https://i.gyazo.com/4ad644d48fa969161e193be6a4abc25f.png) Hey guys,

> **Update: 6/17/2017 @ 4:55pm Pacific**
> It looks like AMD released a driver update recently that may be able to help with this issue! If this update was useful, please comment down below to let us know!


> **Update: 5/30/2017 @ 9:20am Pacific**
> 
> As we continue to investigate, we've found that [turning on AMD GPU Scaling](http://support.amd.com/en-us/kb-articles/Pages/UnableToSetGPUScaling.aspx) can act as a workaround for some players in the meantime.  


----

We've received quite a few reports of DirectX errors from players post champion select.  It looks like there might be an issue with AMD's most recent graphics driver causing this error.  While we investigate further, we've found that rolling back to a [Previous AMD Display Driver ](http://support.amd.com/en-us/download/desktop/previous?os=Windows%2010%20-%2064)can serve as a workaround in the meantime.

I'll post updates or anymore info as they come.  As always, thanks for the reports and assist!  {{summoner:31}}

GUYS I FIXED IT, try this:

Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln\releases\0.0.1.180\deploy

Right-click on League of Legends.exe, go to the compatibility tab and check the Disable fullscreen optimizations.

I HOPE THIS HELPS, it took me two months to figure it out.
TOU ARE MY HERO ! FINNALY SOMETHING THAT WORKS

UPDATE: Turns out the problem isn't solely AMD based.  I reinstalled the game and it didn't help. (even though i had to reinstall Dx9 with the game.) So, on a whim i decided to reinstall the same Nvidia driver (the most up-to-date version of drivers) via geforce experience, and once i did that the game seems to be working fine now. If i have any more issues i will edit this post to explain further, But for anybody having an issue with Nvidia based GPUs follow my advice and i hope it works for you!
